page.title: 08The Bold Forester,Marchwood
page.content: The{Bold Forester public house} is a smart and popular meeting place some two kilometres west of the village of Marchwood.Although it is rather isolated it attracts many customers from a wide area.It has a large bar and meals are served.They have a garden with picnic tables in.Also inside they have a skittle alley. The pub started off as a thatched cottage.The first landlord was a forester himself.He employed people to chop trees down.While they worked they would get hot and thirsty.The landlord would give them eight pints of beer a day and would deduct the cost from their salaries.The landlord would then transport the wood to different places and it would be used as firewood,for farm buildings,gates and fences.
